hackathon-description-text: Now in year two, JAMCHESTER is an annual, weekend-long video game creation competition. It will take place at The Studio event space in the heart of Manchester, UK.

hackathon-judges.judge-role: Games Director at Supermassive Games Ltd
Creative Director & Founder at No Code
Lead Editor at The Sound Architect
Founder of Altered Gene & Freelance Producer for Square Enix Collective
Associate Producer at XDev Studios Europe

hackathon-eligibility:
You must be aged 18 or over.
Teams can be made up of one to four people.
hackathon-requirements:
Games must be based on the theme annouced at the start of the event. Only games created during in the 40 hour jam will be considered for judging.
Your submission must include the following;
1) Team Name
2) Name of the Game
3) Team Members
4) Description
5) Link to where the game can be played e.g. Github, Dropbox,
hackathon-rules:
All attendees, sponsors, partners, volunteers and staff at our game jam are required to agree with the following code of conduct.
Organisers will enforce this code throughout the event. We expect cooperation from all participants to ensure a safe environment for everybody.
Our game jam is dedicated to providing a harassment-free experience for everyone, regardless of gender, gender identity and expression, age, sexual orientation, disability, physical appearance, body size, race, ethnicity, nationality, religion, previous hackathon attendance or computing experience (or lack of any of the aforementioned).
We do not tolerate harassment of game jam participants in any form. Sexual language and imagery is not appropriate at any game jam venue, including hacks, talks, workshops, parties, social media and other online media. Game jam participants violating these rules may be sanctioned or expelled from the game jam without a refund (if applicable) at the discretion of the organisers.
hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=51 Lever St, Manchester M1 1FN, UK

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: How your game looks, how well it uses colour and composition, how well the visuals blend together and represent the essence of the idea.
How well thought out and structured your game is. How mechanically fun it is to play. How well it solves gameplay issues and how each part of the game integrates with the whole.
Not just music and sound effects. How well your game uses audio to complement and enhance the design and art. How does your game feel as a result of the audio.
Not just complexity or detail but how impressive a creation you have made. Have you created new systems and technology? How would others benefit from the advancement?
Big, new, inspiring and intriguing ideas. Have you done something no one else has? Have you developed something to a new level? How creative have you been with the theme?
At college or university? This is your chance to compete alongside professionals and show what you can do. All team members must still be in full time Education to qualify.
Team - Already working for a company? Let's see how impressive your group can be outside of your regular studio or office environment.
The best overall game experience. Must be the best overall game, something outstanding and impressive. How complete, rounded and strong is the game as a whole.

hackathon-description-header: The UK's largest competitive game jam
